instruction_sections.name: Blanching
steps: Boil enough water (violently) to fully submerge the broccoli and add salt (1 tbsp) and oil (1 tsp)
Once the water reaches a violent boil
Add the Broccoli stalks first and then the Broccoli florets, ensuring they are fully submerged
Cover and bring to a boil again (roughly 3 minutes depending on how good your burner is)
Once Boiling, immediately remove broccoli and place in the Ice Water using a spider strainer
Discard the hot water
Transfer broccoli from cold bath to strainer to drain

instruction_sections.name: Stir Fry
steps: Heat pan until hot, then lower heat. You DO NOT want to burn the garlic or the stir fry will taste bitter
Add oil (2 tbsp) and swirl until hot (it will get runnier and feel thinner), add garlic (4–5 cloves)
Stir to coat with the oil and add the ginger (1/2 oz)

Stir constantly for 20–30 seconds, then put the heat on high and add broccoli, stirring constantly (You should hear sizzling from moisture evaporation. If you can’t hear your cooking you’re not stirfrying you’re boiling, and your pan isn’t hot enough)
Add Shaoxing Wine (1 tsp), pouring it in from the edges so it sizzles. This is important for aromatics.
Slowly add in the Sauce a bit at a time while stirring, making sure not to make the dish soggy
Stir continuously for about 1 min, then add oil (about 1 tbsp) and mix
Plate and serve, making sure to get all the sauce from the pan

instruction_sections.name: Cooking
steps: Sear chicken using the Ghee (not oil or butter), set aside.
Same pan, Onions, Salt, Garlic, Ginger, cook until softened
Add Garam Masala, Kashmiri Chili, Tumeric, Fenugreek Powder, Sugar, cook until fragent
Add crushed tomatoes and reduce for 2 mins, then blend in blender
Add sauce + chicken back to pan and simmer for seven minutes
add heavy creme, simmer another 7 minutes
Cut heat, stir in butter, salt to taste

instruction_sections.name: Prep
steps: Slice zucchini.
Slice radish, onion, green onion, chili peppers, and mushrooms.
Slice pork and season lightly with black pepper.

instruction_sections.name: Pork & Chili Oil
steps: In a pot, add cooking oil generously and stir-fry pork with black pepper until cooked through.
Add red chili powder and stir-fry on low heat to release color and aroma.

instruction_sections.name: Broth & Season
steps: Add water and gochujang; bring to a boil.
Add soup soy sauce, tuna extract (or fish sauce), sugar, and minced garlic; mix well.

instruction_sections.name: Simmer Veg 1
steps: Add radish, onion, potato, and mushrooms; simmer until radish is soft and flavors blend.

instruction_sections.name: Finish
steps: Add zucchini slices and chili peppers at the end; simmer briefly.

instruction_sections.name: Finish – Green Onion
steps: Add green onion at the very end; stir once and serve hot.

instruction_sections.name: Marinate
steps: Mix marinade until smooth.
Toss with chicken; marinate at least 30 min (4 hrs to overnight preferred).

instruction_sections.name: Cook
steps: Preheat large skillet over medium‑high; add oil.
Add vegetables and rice cakes; place chicken on top.
Cook 3–4 min, then reduce to medium/low and stir often until chicken is cooked and veg tender (10–15 min).
Cover as needed to speed cooking. Serve with rice.

instruction_sections.name: Marinade
steps: Mix marinade ingredients until smooth.
Add sliced pork; marinate 30 minutes (or longer).

instruction_sections.name: Stir-Fry Pork
steps: Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
Add marinated pork; stir-fry until mostly cooked.

instruction_sections.name: Add Veg
steps: Add onion, carrot (if using), and minced garlic; stir-fry until vegetables are tender and pork is fully cooked.

instruction_sections.name: Finish
steps: Add green onions; stir for 1 minute.
Drizzle a little sesame oil and season with black pepper to taste. Serve hot with rice.

instruction_sections.name: Prep
steps: Assemble prep groups as described.

instruction_sections.name: Season & Fry Beef
steps: Heat peanut oil in wok.
Toss beef in Beef Coating; shallow‑fry until browned; set aside.

instruction_sections.name: Aromatics & Sauce
steps: Sear green onions ~1 minute until caramelized.
Add Aromatics & Chili; stir‑fry 45 seconds.
Add Brown Sugar, then Sauce Base; boil and reduce ~3 minutes until slightly thickened.

instruction_sections.name: Finish
steps: Return beef; toss until sauce glazes.
Cut heat; add Thai basil and garlic; toss to combine.

instruction_sections.name: Prep – Everything
steps: Gather and set out all ingredients.
Drain beans in a colander, rinse well, and set aside.
Have salt within reach.
Chop onions (not too small; large enough to soak flavor, but not so large they turn slimy/mushy).
Rough‑chop garlic: small enough to extract flavor, large enough not to disintegrate instantly.
Use stainless steel for all cooking steps.
Safety: wear glasses, a long‑sleeve shirt, and cooking gloves to guard against hot oil splatter.

instruction_sections.name: Sweat the Onions
steps: Heat a stainless pan on full burner until water beads and floats.
Add avocado oil to coat the pan; immediately add onions.
Keep heat high; push onions constantly until the loud hissing subsides; add 2 pinches of salt to help.
When hissing dies down and onions are slightly caramelized and soft, remove and set aside.
Rinse and wipe the pan completely for the next step.

instruction_sections.name: Brown the Meat
steps: Heat pan on high until water floats; add just enough avocado oil to coat.
Place 1 brick of ground beef in the center. Oil the top to prevent sticking and press into a thin slab for max surface area.
Lower heat to about halfway; cook 2–3 minutes until a very dark brown sear forms (water must evaporate).
Flip; cook another 2–3 minutes.
Break up the meat; remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Repeat with the second brick.
There should be plenty of beef fat in the pan—add some to the reserved beef and leave the rest in the pan.

instruction_sections.name: Build the Flavor
steps: Lower to low/medium; add garlic to the beef fat; stir ~30 seconds until very fragrant and lightly toasted.
Return onions; cook 30–60 seconds.
Add chili powder, 1 tsp salt, cumin, oregano, and cayenne; stir to coat. Mixture will be dry and stick to the pan—toast ~1 minute.
Pour in tomato sauce and raise heat to medium; scrape up fond and cook until the sauce turns a deep beet‑red color.
Remove pan from heat.

instruction_sections.name: Combine
steps: Heat a stainless pot until ripping hot.
Deglaze with 1/4 cup red wine; cook ~30 seconds (it should hiss).
Add browned beef.
Add the tomato/spice/onion mixture.
Add 3 cups beef broth (will reduce over simmer).
Add beans.
Add baker’s chocolate.

instruction_sections.name: Simmer
steps: Cover and simmer on low for 1 hour.
Every 15 minutes stir gently to lift fond from the bottom (no hard scraping needed; after 30–60 sec it releases on its own).
If nothing sticks, raise the simmer slightly. If too dry near the end, add up to 1 cup more broth a little at a time.

instruction_sections.name: Final Touches
steps: Make a slurry: 1/4 cup masa harina + 1/2 cup cold water. Never add masa directly—only the slurry.
Stir slurry into chili; add 1/4 tsp MSG.
Taste and add salt 1/4 tsp at a time until just slightly saltier than seems right when hot (it mutes as it cools).

instruction_sections.name: Prep
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Stir glaze: brown sugar + rice vinegar + maple syrup + black pepper.

instruction_sections.name: Bake & Baste
steps: Place bacon on a rack set over a sheet pan.
Bake 10 min; flip and bake 5 min.
Brush both sides with glaze; bake 5 min.
Repeat glazing every 5 min until browned and crisp, ~35 min total.

instruction_sections.name: Marinate
steps: Mix marinade ingredients until smooth.
Toss with chicken; marinate 30 minutes to overnight.

instruction_sections.name: Cook
steps: Heat large skillet over medium‑high; add oil.
Add cabbage, sweet potato, carrot, perilla, and rice cakes; place chicken on top.
Cook 3–4 minutes, then reduce to medium/low; stir often until chicken is cooked and veg tender (10–15 minutes).
Cover if needed to speed cooking; serve with rice.
